question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the second component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 0\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 4 & 5\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 0\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 4 & 5\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the second component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}2 & 2\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}-3 & 3\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct! These vectors are orthogonal, so the vector projection is the zero vector.
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2 & 3\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}2 & -1 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the third component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}-2 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}-2 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the second component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 1 & 1\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}2 & 2 & 2\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct! In this case, $\mathbf{b}$ is a scalar multiple of $\mathbf{a}$, so the vector projection is simply $\mathbf{b}$.
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 0\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}0 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the first component of the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$. Give your answer to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct! These vectors are orthogonal, so the vector projection is the zero vector.
Incorrect. Recall that the vector projection of $\mathbf{b}$ onto $\mathbf{a}$ is $\left( \mathbf{b}\cdot \mathbf{a} / \| \mathbf{a} \|^2\right) \mathbf{a}$.
